headline.main: RED ARMY HALTS PUSH ON MOSCOW; Soviet Also Reports Germans Slowed in Crimea -- Berlin Claims New Gain There

lead_paragraph: BERNE, Switzerland, Thursday, Nov. 8 -- After days of bitter fighting, Russian forces have broken the Germans' newest major offensive against Moscow, it was announced this morning by the Russian radio. An authoritative commentator added that stubborn resistance by Red Army troops in newly consolidated positions in Crimea was getting the situation in hand there.
abstract: USSR forces claim German offensive against Moscow broken; claim Germans slowed, Crimea; Germans claim new gains, Crimea; USSR troops gain, Donets basin; German attack repulsed, Leningrad; map
